intro: Senecio praecox var. morelensis, commonly known as the Morel's early senecio, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
